entry.title: Douglas County Enters 2025 Fire Season: What You Need to Know
entry.summary: Fire season is now in effect across the Douglas District. DFPA has set Public Use Restrictions to “Moderate” and Industrial Fire Precaution Level to 1. Campfires are limited, off-road driving is restricted, and chainsaw or mowing hours are now reduced to prevent wildfire risk.

entry.title: Douglas County Sheriff's Office Tactical Response, Crisis Negotiation Teams Called to Disturbance

entry.title: Art-cuterie: charcuterie business Olive and Madrone to launch in Roseburg this summer.
entry.summary: Art functions as a way for people to express themselves creatively regardless of the medium. For artist Michelle Torina, her medium doesn’t use ink, clay or rolls of film; it uses food.

entry.title: Amidst move to ban syringe exchange on city property, HIV Alliance halts exchange at parks
entry.summary: As of early May, HIV Alliance, a nonprofit that provides care to those affected by or at risk for HIV in Oregon, has halted syringe exchange programs out of Roseburg city property.

entry.title: Winston’s Fourth of July Fireworks Are Officially Back On
entry.summary: Winston’s 4th of July fireworks are officially back on for their 5th year! Thanks to community support and the WAID team, the celebration will light up the sky once again. A community meeting is set for June 5 at 6 PM at Riverbend Park. All are welcome to join and get involved.

entry.title: DFPA Declares Start of 2025 Fire Season for Douglas District
entry.summary: Fire season for the Douglas District begins Friday, June 6, 2025 at 12:01 AM. DFPA has set public use restrictions to Moderate and IFPL to Level I. The declaration applies to all private, state, federal, and BIA lands in the district. Fire safety rules are now in effect to help prevent wildfires.

entry.title: Adopt a ‘Three Bear Strategy’
entry.summary: This year has brought a number of significant changes with it, probably to no surprise of most people in the United States. The largest change was undoubtedly in the political arena. entry.title: Wind-Driven Grass Fire Burns Over 6 Acres Northwest of Roseburg
entry.summary: A wind-driven grass fire northwest of Roseburg burned 6.5 acres Monday afternoon. Crews from multiple agencies stopped the fire’s spread. Officials urge residents to take precautions when using powered equipment near dry vegetation as fire season approaches.

entry.title: Summer of construction: A look at ongoing major projects in Douglas County

entry.title: Riddle Activity Center secures building permit
entry.summary: RIDDLE — Johnny Mcelroy envisions the Riddle Activity Center as a “mental health hub” for the city. For the founder of Neighborhood Behavioral Health, one organization moving into the center following its launch, the space can’t get here fast enough.

A joint release...

entry.title: Crash Claims Life of 19-Year-Old Motorcyclist in Roseburg
entry.summary: A crash on NW Stewart Parkway Saturday night claimed the life of 19-year-old motorcyclist Zevin Alvarez. Roseburg Police say the driver of a car admitted to running a red light. The investigation remains ongoing.

entry.title: Attic Fire Displaces Family in Green on Monday Afternoon
entry.summary: A fire in the attic of a Green home Monday displaced several adults, children, and pets. Crews from CDF&R and partner agencies contained the fire in 20 minutes. The likely cause was a discarded cigarette. The American Red Cross is assisting the displaced family.

entry.title: CENTRAL DOUGLAS FIRE AND RESCUE RESPONDS TO HOME FIRE IN GREEN
entry.summary: June 3, 2025 4;00 a.m. Crews with Central Douglas Fire & Rescue responded to a fire at a home in Green on Monday. Division Chief – Fire Marshal Josh Waechter said just after 2:30 p.m. firefighters were dispatched to a reported porch fire at a residence in the 100 block of Pear Tree Lane. Waechter...

entry.title: DCSO SAYS RECURRING SCAM IS BACK IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: June 3, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is once again warning residents about a common scam that has resurfaced in the community. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said individuals are receiving fraudulent calls claiming there is some type of law enforcement matter that needs attention. O’Dell said the caller, often using the names of...

entry.title: ODOT CLARIFIES INFORMATION ON NIGHTTIME PAVING IN REEDSPORT
entry.summary: June 3, 2025 3:30 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The Oregon Department of Transportation has clarified information on paving work happening this week in the City of Reedsport. Dan Latham said ODOT is only paving U.S. Highway 101, not any side streets. Latham said highway paving work is going from the Umpqua River Bridge to...

entry.title: FREE FISHING WEEKEND WITH EVENTS ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY
entry.summary: June 3, 2025 3:20 a.m. Everyone can fish, clam, and crab for free in Oregon this Saturday and Sunday. A release from the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife said no fishing/shellfish licenses or tags are required on these days. Both Oregon residents and nonresidents can participate. Oregon State Parks also offers free parking and...

entry.title: LEAGUE OF WOMEN VOTERS SPRING GARDEN TOUR ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: June 3, 2025 3:05 a.m. The League of Women Voters of Umpqua Valley will have their Spring Garden Tour this Saturday. The event will take place from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. at 6 private homes around the Roseburg area. Each location will feature gardens to view and will be accompanied by working artists and...

entry.title: UCC CONCERT BAND PRESENTS “STATES OF MIND” ON WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: June 3, 2025 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: UCC Performing and Visual Arts has the UCC Concert Band presenting “States of Mind:” on Wednesday night at 7:00 p.m. in Jacoby Auditorium. This concert features music that explores the depths of human emotion and thought. Each piece provides a glimpse into a distinct state...

entry.title: Bloomapalooza just keeps growing
entry.summary: GLIDE — Blooms and booming small businesses were on display under the sunshine at this year’s Bloomapalooza Iris Festival.

entry.title: ‘Take this moment to embrace the chances you're being given’ — Yoncalla High School class of 2025 graduates
entry.summary: 2025 Yoncalla High School graduates were draped in blue and white for their graduation ceremony May 30 in the school’s gymnasium.

entry.title: Observatory cancels summer public programs
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — Umpqua Community College's Paul Morgan Observatory cancelled summer public program events due to construction at the college's track. The Moon Watch event on June 7 and the public night on June 20 are both cancelled.
